snippet: Demanding his acquittal, Anders Behring Breivik took the stand for the first time, describing his killing of 77 people last year as a “sophisticated political act.”
abstract: Anders Behring Breivik defiantly takes the stand for the first time in his trial for killing 77 people in Norway; he demands that he be acquitted and reads a prepared statement, offering Norwegians in the courtroom a chance to hear him personally outline his reasons for the attack.

byline.original: By MARK LEWIS and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Mark Lewis reported from Oslo, and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: Demanding his acquittal, Anders Behring Breivik took the stand for the first time, describing his killing of 77 people last year as a “sophisticated political act.”

headline.seo: On Witness Stand in Norway, Breivik Says He’d Kill Again
headline.main: On Witness Stand, Norwegian Says He Would Kill Again
headline.print_headline: On Witness Stand, Norwegian Who Killed 77 Says He Would Do It Again
